passage: American writer Edwidge Danticat, who emigrated from Haiti in 1981, has won acclaim for her powerful short stories, novels, and ______ blank her lyrical yet unflinching depictions of her native country's turbulent history, writer Robert Antoni has compared Danticat to Nobel Prizeâ€“winning novelist Toni Morrison.
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. The convention being tested is punctuation use between sentences. In this choice, the period after "essays" is used correctly to mark the boundary between one sentence ("American…essays") and another ("praising…Morrison"). The participial phrase beginning with "Praising" modifies the subject of the second sentence, "writer Robert Antoni."
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect because it results in a comma splice. A comma can't be used in this way to mark the boundary between sentences.
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect. Without a comma preceding it, the conjunction "and" can't be used in this way to join sentences.
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because it results in a run-on sentence. The sentences ("American…essays" and "Praising…Morrison") are fused without punctuation and/or a conjunction.
